citation.article-title: Enterococcus dispar sp. nov. a new Enterococcus species from human sources.

p.s: Description of Enterococcus dispar sp. nov.
Enterococcus dispar (dis'par: L. adj. dispar dissimilar, different)
Cells are Gram-positive, ovoid and occur mostly in pairs or short chains.
Grows at 10 and 40°C but not at 45°C.
Grows in 6.5% NaCl and on bile-aesculin agar.
Acid is produced from glycerol, lactose, melebiose, rafinose, ribose, salicin, sucrose and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from L-arabinose, amidon, inulin, glycogen, mannitol, sorbose and sorbitol.
Arginine dihydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-gaiactosidase, pyrolidonylarylamidase and leucine arylamidase positive.
Pyruvate is utilized. β-glucuronidase and alkaline phosphatase negative.
The G + C content of DNA is 39 mol%, as determined by melting temperature.
The type strain E18-1 has been deposited in the National Collection of Food Bacteria (NCFB 2821) and the National Collection of Industrial and Marine Bacteria (NCIMB 13000).
